title: shared context and 'its' runs 'before' twice
body:
Hi, from my understanding this is a bug:

Running (https://gist.github.com/1904749):

``` ruby
describe 'shared context and its' do
  shared_context :shared => :ctx do
    before{ puts 'before';raise if @x; @x = true }
  end

  describe 'failing', :shared => :ctx do
    its(:length){}
    it(:ok){}
  end
end
```

Prints:

```
RSpec::Issue
  shared context and its
    failing
before
      ok
      length
before
before
         (FAILED - 1)

Failures:

  1) RSpec::Issue shared context and its failing length 
     Failure/Error: before{ puts 'before';raise if @x; @x = true }
     RuntimeError:
     # ./spec/rspec/issue_spec.rb:8:in `block (4 levels) in <top (required)>'

Finished in 0.0777 seconds
2 examples, 1 failure

Failed examples:

rspec ./spec/rspec/issue_spec.rb:12 # RSpec::Issue shared context and its failing length 
```

So the before-hook is run once for the it-example, but twice for the its-example. From my understanding it should only be run once in both.

EDIT: 
Seems like the 'its' is not the root cause. The cause is nesting another describe-block inside a describe block that uses a shared context:

``` ruby
    describe 'shared context and its' do
        shared_context :shared => :ctx do
            before{ puts 'before';raise if @x; @x = true }
        end

        describe 'outer', :shared => :ctx do
            it(:ok){}
            describe 'inner' do
                it{ :fails }
            end
        end
    end
```

EDIT 2:
This only seems to happen when using meta-data to use the context. When using include_context the example passes.

EDIT 3: rspec version: 2.8.0
